segments.text: Could you help me figure out how to look for a job ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: We have lots of options , what type of job do you need ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I want to work in an office .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Do you want to work part-time or full-time ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: We have binders with local job listings or you can make use of the computers . OK ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I am confused a bit but I am sure that I can figure it out .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: If you make an appointment with a job counselor , they can also provide you with a lot of information . Do you want to see a counselor ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: No , I don't think I need to do that .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Well , you know that this job center is here for your use , so help yourself . Good luck !
segments.speaker: S2
